title.narrative: Modernization of Water Supply and Sanitation Services

description.narrative: The proposed Development Objective is to increase access to, and quality of, water and sanitation services in selected areas, and develop the Borrower’s sectoral institutions and participating EPS management capacity to provide efficient water and sanitation services.

condition.narrative: Section IA2 (a, b, c and d). Institutional Arrangements.The Borrower shall: - cause OTASS to operate and maintain OTASS-PIU 2within OTASS. - not later than ninety (90) days after the Effective Date, hire the OTASS-PIU 2 key staff: coordinator, financialmanagement specialist, procurement specialist.- operate and maintain PNSU-FU within PNSU.- not later than ninety (90) days afterthe Effective Date, hire the PNSU-FU staff: coordinator, financial management specialist and procurement specialist.

Section IA3. Institutional Arrangements.Not later than sixty (60) days after the Effective Date, the Borrower shall create andmaintain the Project Coordinating Committee to oversee the implementation of the Project.

Section IB1, IB2, IB3 and IB4. Implementation Arrangements. The Borrower, through PNSU, shall enter into an agreement withOTASS.Prior to Part 2 of the Project, the Borrower, thorugh PNSU shall, and shall cause OTASS to enter into a participationagreement with each participating EPS, under terms and conditions acceptable to the Bank. The Borrower shall cause OTASS to ensurecompliance with the targets for the performance indicators at the participant EPS level.To carry out Part 1.1 of the Project, theBorrower shall cause OTASS to enter into an agreement with SUNASS.

Section ID. Safeguards. The Borrower shall: - implement the Project in accordance with the ESMF (EIA if applicable), the IPPF,the RPF and the ARAP, comply and adopt procedures detailed in the instruments, and implement the pertinent plans; - ensure ToR ofconsultancies are acceptable to the Bank; bidding documents and contracts for civil works comply with Safeguard obligations, managerisks and impacts and enforce code of conducts; and maintain the GRM.
